section.p: Your aerial journey gives you a marvellous opportunity to study the lay of the land, but it is hard to drink in all the details.

‘An extraordinary craft,’ you say to the wizard. ‘How do you steer it?’
‘You have put your finger on the one aspect of the design that I have yet to perfect. For the nonce we must rely on fate, prayer, chance and wishful thinking.’
Eventually the balloon comes to rest in the upper branches of a tree and you hastily disembark.
